result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:35 AM Defendant Adam C Arrowood in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Adam C Arrowood.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Molly Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. Defendant can be returned from Brown County Jail.  Atty. Bonneson is not sure if the defendant will be in custody at the next hearing or not.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: 3030 Curry Lane, C/O Brown County Jail, Green Bay, WI 54311 United States
filed, to be produced from Brown County Jail.

9:16 AM Defendant Adam C Arrowood appeared by Zoom, in custody, from the Brown County Jail. Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Adam C Arrowood.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Attorney Bonneson is asking for an adjournment and for the defendant to be produced as he has not received the waiver form back from the defendant. The defendant states he sent the waiver back to Attorney Bonneson a couple days ago. Attorney Bonneson is waiving time limits. The Court will adjourn and set this matter for a waiver of prelim. Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Brown County Jail. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Hearing on September 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.

9:16 AM Defendant Adam C Arrowood in court by zoom video from Brown County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Adam C Arrowood.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin.
Court informs defendant of appearing via zoom.
Atty. Bonneson states he has not been able to discuss a waiver of preliminary hearing with the defendant and states the defendant refused to be produced to Waukesha County for today's hearing.
Defendant will be at the Brown County Jail until October, 2022.
Atty. Bonneson reads the offer to the defendant.
Defendant states he will waive the preliminary hearing.  
Bail remains as fixed. 
Court adjourns for status of preliminary hearing or possible waiver of preliminary hearing.  Defendant to appear by zoom from the Brown County Jail for the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Claire from WSD, called to tell the courts, that the defendant refused to come with Deputies (Def @ Brown Co jail) for prelim on 8/29/2022. Brown County Jail ordered to have a zoom hearing for that 8/29 prelim hearing.
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Brown County Jail

10:54 AM Defendant Adam C Arrowood in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Bonneson states he was not allowed to talk to his client as visitation was closed over the weekend and requests to adjourn the matter.
The State has no objection.
Preliminary time limits previously waived.
The Court will adjourn.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT BE PRODUCED FROM THE BROWN COUNTY JAIL IF THE MATTER GOES TO A HEARING.  THE COURT WILL ALLOW ZOOM FROM BROWN COUNTY JAIL, IF A PRELIM WAIVER IS FILED TIMELY.
THE DEFENDANT IS TRYING TO GET A BAIL REDUCTION IN HIS BROWN CONUTY CASE AND IF APPOVED MAY BE OUT OF CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.
filed, to be produced from Brown county Jail

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with Home Depot/co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint.

02:36 PM Defendant Adam C Arrowood appeared by Zoom, in custody, from the Brown County Jail with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson who appeared by Zoom.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Brown County Jail.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.
